verbs.description: cockbill (third-person singular simple present cockbills, present participle cockbilling, simple past and past participle cockbilled)

entries.meaning: (nautical, transitive) To tilt up one end of, so as to make almost vertical.
examples: to cockbill the yards as a sign of mourning

entries.meaning: (nautical, transitive) To suspend (the anchor) from the cathead preparatory to letting it go.
